subject: ClassCastException with dom4j
msgSnippet: Hi All, I seem to be having a classloader problem.  I ve checked the FAQ and saw the entry about having org.w3c.dom.* and org.xml.sax.* in the
messageBody:
Hi All,

I seem to be having a classloader problem. I've checked the FAQ and
saw the entry about having org.w3c.dom.* and org.xml.sax.* in the
excluded.properties file. I'm using junit 3.8.1, so these entries
already exist.

Attempting to execute the simple test below using the Swing UI
TestRunner throws a ClassCastException. Executing the same test from
within the eclipse framework or the text UI works properly, however.

Obviously, I'm missing something fundamental here. Any help would be
greatly appreciated!


import org.dom4j.util.XMLErrorHandler;
import junit.framework.TestCase;

public class SampleTest extends TestCase
{
public SampleTest(String name)
{
super(name);
}

public testException()
{
XMLErrorHandler handler = new XMLErrorHandler();
}
}
